title: Not your key not your BTC
author: Not your key not your BTC
content: Today, 15 years ago satoshi announced a new Bitcoin forum here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5.0just to remind us if this forum is already old, I hope this forum continues to exist and provides benefits to the next generation as well.

comments.author: PremiumcryptoHub
comments.created_time: November 22, 2024, 03:03:49 AMLast edit: November 22, 2024, 07:11:23 PM by PremiumcryptoHub
comments.body: Yes, today is the day that an anonymous person named Satoshi Nakamoto welcomed everyone back to this extensive forum. Satoshi Nakamoto welcomed everyone to the new BitcoinTalk forum on November 22, 2009 (06:04:28PM). Almost 13 years have passed today on November 22, 2024.Even today we remember the great man who created this forum and Bitcoin. Maybe as long as Bitcoin and this forum exist, the people of this world will remember him with reverence. He is a true legend.

comments.author: bitebits
comments.body: Thanks for noticing and sharing. That is a special date. Been spending more than 10 years in this place and it is still fully alive and its archive will probably be researched for decades. Does anyone know backups are being made in case this place gets hacked?

comments.author: ndutndut
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on November 22, 2024, 12:09:33 AMToday, 15 years ago satoshi announced a new Bitcoin forum here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5.0just to remind us if this forum is already old, I hope this forum continues to exist and provides benefits to the next generation as well.It's amazing that this forum is more than a decade old, of course there have been many benefits and ideas born from this forum. What's interesting is that today bitcoin has also reached its highest price in history, which is $ 99,419, this can be interpreted as an extraordinary celebration for this forum too.Because with this forum bitcoin can also be like it is now, growing, growing and continuing to grow until later many countries adopt bitcoin.Thank you very much, my friend, for remembering it, because this is also new information for me personally.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on November 22, 2024, 12:09:33 AMToday, 15 years ago satoshi announced a new Bitcoin forum here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5.0just to remind us if this forum is already old, I hope this forum continues to exist and provides benefits to the next generation as well.Congratulations to all of us including Satoshi for this great and awesome opportunity, how would i have met with some amazing personalities from this forum if it wasn't created in the first place, how could i have developed myself with increasing knowledge about myself and the financial economy if this noble forum wasn't created, and lastly, how could i have been this expose if there is no such a learning and discussion platform like this, which is well moderated and far better than other social media platforms, this forum will always be remembered along with Satoshi for life.

comments.author: Tmoonz
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on November 22, 2024, 12:09:33 AMToday, 15 years ago satoshi announced a new Bitcoin forum here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5.0just to remind us if this forum is already old, I hope this forum continues to exist and provides benefits to the next generation as well.Surely, it is a great achievement for the entire community of this forum and more especially to the legend the man who has made possible Satoshi Nakamoto, I am so glad that am part of this community which has impacted so much in me not only in Bitcoin and cryptocurrency but life generally, i may not have known what i knew today if not for the forum, indeed the forum is educative, informative with a friendly environment for learning, seeing when all this started and where it is today it really calls so much excitement and thanks @ the op for the reminder.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Hmm, 15 Years Bitcointalk is still one of the teens, and I'm waiting for your 21st birthday to tell you what your grandpa left for you. I'm curious to ask if you will be able to handle the responsibilities consistently in the future???. Anyway, who knows Bitcoin is close to $100k and we've come this far from nothing $100k let's hope for good in the future too. Still keep your responsibilities in count always (Bitcoiners & BitcointalkÂ  )

comments.author: DaNNy001
comments.body: Quote from: Hamza2424 on November 22, 2024, 07:29:47 PMHmm, 15 Years Bitcointalk is still one of the teens, and I'm waiting for your 21st birthday to tell you what your grandpa left for you. I'm curious to ask if you will be able to handle the responsibilities consistently in the future???. Anyway, who knows Bitcoin is close to $100k and we've come this far from nothing $100k let's hope for good in the future too. Still keep your responsibilities in count always (Bitcoiners & Bitcointalk Â )$100k is just by the corner if not even this night ðŸ˜Ž. Congratulations to the community too. 15yrs is no joke and the consistency of the progress of the community is something to write home about because it's not easy to actually maintain a community and aslo stay in check from all the possible errors that might have been made it crash.So kudos to all everyone who have helped maintain and keep this community striving.. @theymos, Cyrus and many others.

comments.author: finaleshot2016
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on November 22, 2024, 12:09:33 AMToday, 15 years ago satoshi announced a new Bitcoin forum here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5.0just to remind us if this forum is already old, I hope this forum continues to exist and provides benefits to the next generation as well.Didn't expect that I'm part of the half of the 15 years.Learned a lot here and made something that could change my life. Tbh it's a great achievement for me that I've managed to stay here despite having dips in the market. My efforts during the merits days is really worth it.Crypto dont focus on money, itâ€™s about being part of a community that goes against traditional systems, and tbh, Iâ€™m proud to be part of that.Itâ€™s made me think differently (see things on the other side of the world, not corpo things), learn how to adapt when things donâ€™t go as planned, and spot opportunities where most people just see risks. I quitted my job because I gained big on crypto, and my skills are also mistreated in the corpo world. Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m happy freelancing alongside crypto was normalized, it really worked out in our favor. Especially during the pandemic, crypto was a lifesaver for me. Watching how this space grew from being misunderstood to something thatâ€™s now recognized globally feels like being part of history. Let's go 100k!!!!

comments.author: macson
comments.body: It doesn't feel like Bitcointalk is already 15 years old (already a teenager) The admin maintains this forum very well.Â  This forum will definitely continue to exist until an unknown time

comments.author: 2Pizza410000BTC
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on November 22, 2024, 12:09:33 AMToday, 15 years ago satoshi announced a new Bitcoin forum here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5.0just to remind us if this forum is already old, I hope this forum continues to exist and provides benefits to the next generation as well.Thank you very much for bringing this auspicious day to us today, the 15th anniversary of the Bitcoin Forum. Today, the Bitcoin Forum has been around for 15 long years and thousands of people are earning a living from it. Today, we can understand from our own perspective what our situation would have been like if this Bitcoin Forum had not been created, so I remember with respect from the bottom of my heart, who has created this Bitcoin Forum among us.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: And to think that in only 15 years bitcoin went from being worth nothing and being seen as some nerd money to being worth almost $100,000 and the most solid payment system that has worked 24/7 all this time without disruption, and a money that many countries are considering to accumulate as their reserves alongside gold...Bitcoin has truly come a long way.

comments.author: Sarah Azhari
comments.body: This forum even seems more ordinary than others but keep exists. we should be proud of being on the forum where our founding father (satoshi) created it.I've always seen this forum as a reference for students if they research something. This means bitcointalk is not just a forum for discussion but for the world of education who are looking for early references to Bitcoin being born.Especially if there is a debate about who is Satoshi. almost all evidence will be referred to this forum, so that it can be revealed who is lies.So, When I look basic Forum Ranking, the Bitcoin forum is ranked 9th. That category (Computers and Internet) is always at the bottom on every rank forum, but bitcointalk get through it all, this is a special forum that is always active, and make people curious to visit it.

comments.author: Sonia_123
comments.body: Happy birthday to Bitcoin in existence,with all the trials and tribulations, you still stand firm and gave succour to a lot of persons and countries at large, today the globe is wishing to have more of you because of your uniqueness can't stop trusting you, long live Bitcoin Forum, Long live Bitcoin Forum Members,Long live Bitcoin Long live Satoshi.!!!HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!!

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on November 22, 2024, 12:09:33 AMToday, 15 years ago satoshi announced a new Bitcoin forum here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5.0just to remind us if this forum is already old, I hope this forum continues to exist and provides benefits to the next generation as well.Happy birthday to the forum and congratulations to everyone here. The forum has maintained its relevance as the foremost discussion platform about Bitcoin. It has proved to be an information bank about the crypto industry because you can get information about almost everything concept about Bitcoin. Congratulations to use because many people don't have the privilege of being part of such a forum which freely offers sound knowledge about revolutionary currency and asset. We hope to see this forum hit more years so that our children will find it useful.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: Notification appears from satoshi's first post, 15th birthday is quite a long time for a forum to survive because many other forums only last a short time and disappear. Happy birthday Bitcointalk, the journey of this forum is a witness to Bitcoin becoming more valuable and will be more valuable in the future

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: I've been a user for almost 1/3rd of its life, and I remember my registration as if it was yesterday. I wouldn't have known about bitcoin without bitcointalk. Kudos to everyone who created an account in here early and foresaw the rise of bitcoin. You're the new elite class. I wish you all the best, and let's make the next 15 years filled with even more quality discussion. Prediction: In the forum's 30th birthday, bitcoin will be worth $10 million, transaction scalability will have improved, SMF software will remain the same, and some user will have been promoted to admin.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: pooya87 on November 23, 2024, 01:45:48 AMAnd to think that in only 15 years bitcoin went from being worth nothing and being seen as some nerd money to being worth almost $100,000It seems that bitcoin deliberately delayed reaching $100k just for this day (for the sake of ceremonially reaching this level on a significant round date?) and has been marking time in one place just below this mark lately.Â   Quote from: pooya87 on November 23, 2024, 01:45:48 AMand the most solid payment system that has worked 24/7 all this time without disruption,If we ignore the case when the mempool was overloaded and transactions were confirmed for a very long time and for high fees. Quote from: pooya87 on November 23, 2024, 01:45:48 AMand a money that many countries are considering to accumulate as their reserves alongside gold...If this happens, there will be very little bitcoins left for ordinary people. Did Satoshi create BTC for countries to use, not for people?Quote from: pooya87 on November 23, 2024, 01:45:48 AMBitcoin has truly come a long way.And let's hope that its path will be long. I mean, the existence of bitcoin.Congratulations to all BTC-supporters on its 15th birthday. It's really cool to see $100k (or almost) on this day. Place bets on how many birthdays it will take to reach $1,000.000.

comments.author: V33R
comments.body: Yes! Happy Birthday Bitcoin forum...In this platform we can learning lot of things of bitcoin and marketing strategy. Then also earning money ðŸ’°ðŸ¤‘

comments.author: Jegileman
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on November 22, 2024, 12:09:33 AMToday, 15 years ago satoshi announced a new Bitcoin forum here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5.0just to remind us if this forum is already old, I hope this forum continues to exist and provides benefits to the next generation as well.Happy birthday to all of us here that keeps the site busy and running through our contributions to discussions here. Satoshi really did well to bring a platform that brings bitcoin enthusiasts together to share thoughts and ideas on how to move bitcoin further. His aim is achieving its course already and itâ€™s a good think to see the forum still running and alive till date. Wishing the forum more and more prosperous years ahead of togetherness.
